The first skirmish, and now I'm ready to castle.
moves.6... a6 7. O-O b5 8. Be2 Nc6 9. h3 Bd6 1: Development is just about finished, as we enter the middle game.
moves.12... f5 13. Nxd6: Naturally I remove the B from the dangerous diagonal.
moves.17... b4 18. Qc4+ Be6 19. Qc2: Still not much happening. I defend my bulwark KP.
moves.19... Nd4 20. Nxd4: I don't want the Black Knight centralized so beautifully.
moves.23... Ng6 24. Kh2 Nf4 25. Bb1: If I allow ...NxB, my Q would have to be used as a blockading piece, a role it is ill-suited for.
moves.25... d3 26. Rfd1: I am trying to win the passed P.
moves.28... Rxf2 29. Bxe2: A self-pin, but winning the piece is worth it.
moves.29... Qg6 30. Rg1: The only move. I must fight off the mating threats.
moves.30... Ba6 31. Qd8+: Ah, this'll force the Rook back.
moves.32... Qf7 33. Qxf7+: Well, now that I've exchanged Queens...
moves.33... Rxf7 34. Bxa6: ...and won a B as well, it's all over but the shouting.
moves.34... Rf2 35. Bxe5 Rxa2 36. Rf1 a4 37. B: Black resigns, as the position is hopeless.
